question: Who was Victor Hugo?
explanation: Victor Hugo was a French poet, novelist, and dramatist of the Romantic movement. He wrote abundantly in an exceptional variety of genres: lyrics, satires, epic, philosophical poems, epigrams, novels, history, critical essays, political speeches, funeral orations, diaries, letters public and private, and dramas in verse and prose. His notable works include "Les Miserables", "Ruy Blas", "The Hunchback of Notre-Dame".
